item.title: Delhi Bakery Owner Dies By Suicide Amid Divorce Dispute, Family Says 'Wife Mentally Tortured Him' - News18
item.description:
Delhi Bakery Owner Dies By Suicide Amid Divorce Dispute; Family Blames Mental Torture by Wife

Date & Source: Last Updated: January 01, 2025, 19:50 IST

Puneet Khurana, a bakery owner in Delhi, reportedly died by suicide amid an ongoing divorce dispute with his wife, according to his family. The couple, married in 2016, co-owned 'For God’s Cake' bakery and another eatery, 'Woodbox Cafe'.

Police seized Khurana's phone and an audio of their last conversation revealed arguments about their bakery business. His family alleged mental torture and harassment by his wife and her relatives.

  • Khurana was 'upset with his wife' before his death, his family said.
  • The couple's last conversation was about their bakery business, as per the police.
  • Khurana's family claimed his wife recorded the conversation and sent it to her relatives.
  • The case comes weeks after a similar incident in Bengaluru, where a techie died by suicide allegedly due to harassment by his wife and her relatives.

If you or someone you know needs help, contact any of these helplines: Aasra (Mumbai) 022-27546669, Sneha (Chennai) 044-24640050, etc.

item.title: Simple tips to shed belly fat in 2025 - The Times of India
item.description:
Tips to Reduce Belly Fat in 2025

Publication Date: Unavailable, Source: Times of India

Is your New Year's resolution to reduce belly fat? A trimmed midsection not only makes you look great but also helps you live longer. A large waistline increases the risk of heart disease, diabetes, cholesterol, and other gastrointestinal issues. Reducing belly fat requires a combination of dietary changes, physical activity, and lifestyle adjustments.

  1. Make a diet plan: A healthy eating plan that includes a low-carb diet, increased intake of fruits, vegetables, proteins, and whole grains can help reduce belly fat.
  2. Be physically active: Engage in exercises like brisk walking, jogging, cycling, swimming, squats, lunges, push-ups, and pull-ups to burn fat.
  3. Reduce stress: Practice yoga, meditation, and ensure quality sleep to regulate hunger hormones and reduce belly fat.
  4. Stay hydrated: Drink plenty of water, reduce alcohol intake, and flush out toxins from the body to curb appetite and reduce belly fat.
  5. Change in lifestyle: Reduce the intake of sugary foods and ultra-processed foods, and avoid packaged foods high in trans fat and sodium.
Nearly 70% of belly fat reduction is achieved through diet.

Making these changes can help you achieve your goal of reducing belly fat in 2025.

More Images of the OnePlus 13R Leak Ahead of Launch

item.title: From Moon to Mercury: Key space missions planned for 2025 - The Jerusalem Post
item.description:
Key Space Missions Planned for 2025

Date & Source: January 1, 2025, The Jerusalem Post

2025 promises to be a pivotal year for space exploration, with major Moon and celestial missions by the U.S., China, Japan, and ESA. These missions promise to advance scientific knowledge and inspire future generations to look to the stars.

  • NASA's Artemis program aims to lay the foundations for human exploration of the Moon and Mars.
  • NASA plans to launch the SPHEREx observatory to map the origins of the universe.
  • China's Tianwen-2 mission will collect samples from an asteroid and a comet.
  • ESA's Space Rider spacecraft will conduct an orbital test flight, and the Jupiter Icy Moons Explorer (JUICE) will study Jupiter's icy moons.
  • ESA and JAXA's BepiColombo mission will study Mercury's composition and surface geology.
  • NASA's Europa Clipper spacecraft and Lucy mission will perform deep-space flybys.
  • Japan's M2/Resilience mission will study lunar soil and test new technologies.
  • Private companies like SpaceX and Intuitive Machines will contribute to lunar exploration.

The article was written with the assistance of a news analysis system.

item.title: Ileana D'Cruz Expecting 2nd Child With Michael? Actress Showcases Pregnancy Test Kit In New Year Post - News18
item.description:
Ileana D'Cruz Expecting 2nd Child With Michael? Actress Showcases Pregnancy Test Kit In New Year Post

Date: January 01, 2025

Source: News18

Ileana D’Cruz has sparked pregnancy rumors after sharing a New Year post featuring a pregnancy test kit.

  • Ileana shared a video compilation of moments from 2024, with a highlight in October showing her emotional display of a pregnancy test kit.
  • The post caption included a hopeful message for 2025, though she did not directly confirm the pregnancy.
  • Fans reacted with excitement, speculating whether she is expecting another child with husband Michael Dolan.
  • The couple welcomed their first child, Koa, in August 2023, celebrating his first birthday recently.
  • Ileana announced her upcoming TV series alongside Vihaan Samat.
“Love. Peace. Kindness. Here’s hoping 2025 is all that and so much more ✨”

The speculation around Ileana's potential second pregnancy has captivated her fanbase, sparking joy and excitement as they look forward to more news.

item.title: OnePlus 13 & OnePlus 13R All Set For India Launch: From Price To Specifications, Here's All You Need To Know - ABP Live
item.description:
OnePlus 13 & OnePlus 13R All Set For India Launch: From Price To Specifications, Here's All You Need To Know

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: ABP Live

The OnePlus 13 series, featuring flagship models OnePlus 13 and OnePlus 13R, is gearing up for its debut in India, with strong expectations based on its design and performance features.

Price In India (Expected)

  • OnePlus 13 starting price around Rs 67,000.
  • OnePlus 13R expected to be priced at approximately Rs 40,000.

What To Expect

  • Both models feature significant design changes, including a flat display.
  • OnePlus 13 equipped with Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset.
  • Camera capabilities tuned by Hasselblad and running OxygenOS 15.
  • Potential for a 6000mAh silicone-carbon battery with rapid charging capabilities.
"The OnePlus 13 could emerge as a strong contender in 2025, especially if its camera performance meets expectations."

In conclusion, the OnePlus 13 series promises to deliver notable advancements in design and technology, positioning it as a competitive force in the Indian smartphone market.

item.title: FDA starts testing raw cheese for bird flu - The Times of India
item.description:
FDA Starts Testing Raw Cheese for Bird Flu

Publication Date: December 7, 2023 Source: Times of India

The FDA has begun testing raw milk cheese as part of a domestic sampling initiative to detect H5N1 bird flu in response to recent outbreaks.

  • The FDA plans to test 300 samples of aged raw milk cheese.
  • Testing will involve both PCR tests and viability tests for the H5N1 virus.
  • If contaminated cheese is detected, the FDA will take necessary follow-up actions, including potential recalls.
“Any samples that test positive for viable virus will be evaluated on a case-by-case basis.”

This action aims to protect consumers and prevent the spread of the virus through dairy products.

item.title: Girl, 3, Rescued 10 Days After Falling Into 700-Foot Borewell In Rajasthan - NDTV
item.description:
Miraculous Rescue: 3-Year-Old Girl Saved After 10 Days in 700-Foot Borewell

Date: December 23, 2022 | Source: NDTV

In a remarkable rescue operation, a three-year-old girl named Chetna was successfully pulled out from a 700-feet deep borewell in Rajasthan's Kotputli, 10 days after she had fallen in. Chetna was immediately hospitalized, and her condition is stable but being closely monitored.

  1. Chetna fell into the borewell on December 23 while playing.
  2. Disaster Relief Forces and a medical team were immediately deployed to rescue her.
  3. Initial attempts to pull her up failed, and a tunnel was dug in the wrong direction.
  4. After several failed efforts and with Chetna's condition deteriorating, she was finally rescued.

"Her condition will continue to be monitored," said hospital authorities.

This grueling rescue mission has been a test of human endurance and a tale of hope amidst despair.

item.title: India, Pakistan exchange list of nuclear installations - Greater Kashmir
item.description:
India and Pakistan Exchange Nuclear Installation Lists Amid Tense Relations

Date & Source: New Delhi, Jan 1, 2023 - Greater Kashmir

Introduction: Despite frosty relations, India and Pakistan continue their annual exchange of nuclear installation lists under a bilateral pact that prohibits attacks on each other’s atomic facilities.

  1. The exchange took place simultaneously through diplomatic channels in New Delhi and Islamabad on January 1, 2023.
  2. The agreement was signed in 1988 and entered into force in 1991, with this year's exchange being the 34th consecutive one.
  3. The exchange comes amid tense relations over the Kashmir issue and cross-border terrorism.
  4. India's External Affairs Minister visited Pakistan in October 2022, signaling a possible thaw in relations.
The ties between the two countries came under severe strain after India’s warplanes pounded a Jaish-e-Mohammed terrorist training camp in Pakistan’s Balakot in February 2019 in response to the Pulwama terror attack.

Conclusion: Despite ongoing tensions, India and Pakistan maintain the exchange of nuclear installation lists, demonstrating a commitment to avoiding nuclear conflict.

item.title: How to calm your mind with breathing, according to science - The Washington Post
item.description:
How to Calm Your Mind with Breathing, According to Science

Publication Date: January 1, 2025 at 7:00 a.m. EST Source: The Washington Post

This article explores the science behind breathing techniques and their effectiveness in reducing stress and enhancing mood. Through conscious breathing, individuals can experience immediate benefits for their mental state.

  • Breathwork practices are beneficial for alleviating stress.
  • Slowing one's breath can lead to improved mood.
  • Research highlights the connection between breathing and emotional regulation.
  • Conscious breathing influences thoughts, feelings, and behavior.
“If you feel even a bit calmer, you have just experienced the power of conscious and intentional breathing.”

In conclusion, integrating breathwork into daily routines can significantly improve mental well-being and emotional stability.

item.title: How to reduce blood sugar: Nutritionist shares a type of food that has 'an enormous effect on lowering blood sugar' levels - GB News
item.description:
Nutritionist Shares a Type of Food That Lowers Blood Sugar

Publication Date: Not Provided Source: GB News

Managing blood sugar levels is challenging in a landscape full of processed carbohydrates. Nutritionist Mark Gilbert suggests building meals around protein to stabilize blood sugar.

  • Focus on consuming protein before starchy or sugary foods.
  • Reducing serving sizes of starchy and sugary foods is crucial.
  • Decreasing visceral fat can help normalize organ function and improve blood sugar levels.
  • Avoid processed carbohydrates to prevent overeating.
  • Other recommended foods for lowering blood sugar include cinnamon, apple cider vinegar, and bitter melon.
“The overall key is to reduce the visceral fat, allowing the organs to function normally again.” - Mark Gilbert

By maintaining consistent dietary changes, individuals can anticipate decreased blood sugar levels over time.

item.title: December GST collections rise 7.3% YoY to Rs 1.77 lakh crore - Moneycontrol
item.description:
December GST collections rise 7.3% YoY to Rs 1.77 lakh crore

Date: January 01, 2025 Source: Moneycontrol

Goods and Services Tax collections rose to Rs 1.77 lakh crore in December, maintaining a level above Rs 1.7 lakh crore for the tenth consecutive month.

  • GST collections increased by 7.3% compared to Rs 1.65 lakh crore in December 2023.
  • Collections were below the Rs 2.1 lakh crore mark reached in April of the previous year.
  • The growth rate of 7.3% is the slowest pace observed in three months.
“India's recent GST collections have slowed down slightly, which is typical after the holiday season. It’s well in line with expectations as we have been witnessing slight decrease in consumer spending over past few months,” said Saurabh Agarwal, Tax Partner, EY India.

Overall, the data suggests a need for monitoring consumer spending trends in the upcoming months to understand potential impacts on future GST collections.

item.title: After Ingenuity's success, Nasa introduces a new 'Mars Chopper' design - Business Standard
item.description:
NASA Unveils New 'Mars Chopper' Design Following Ingenuity's Success

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: NASA News

Nasa has introduced a new helicopter design, the Mars Chopper, which is set to enhance Mars exploration after the success of its predecessor, Ingenuity.

  • The Mars Chopper is larger and equipped with six rotors, each with six smaller blades to increase lift.
  • It has a payload capacity of 5 kg, enabling it to carry scientific instruments for detailed terrain studies.
  • The helicopter demonstrates capabilities to reach distances of up to three kilometers.
  • It aims to assist in exploring areas that are inaccessible to rovers.
  • Ingenuity performed 72 flights over three years, far exceeding its initial mission requirements.
“Scientists could use Chopper to study large swaths of terrain in detail, quickly – including areas where rovers cannot safely travel.” - NASA

The Mars Chopper's advanced design is expected to significantly contribute to future missions, providing vital aerial data for both robotic and potential human explorations.

item.title: Breakaway Moldovan region cuts heat and hot water as Russian gas flow ends - Reuters.com
item.description:
Transdniestria Cuts Heating and Hot Water Amidst Russian Gas Supply Halt

Date: Jan 1, 2023 | Source: Reuters

The breakaway Moldovan region of Transdniestria has halted heating and hot water supplies due to the cessation of Russian gas flow, affecting approximately 450,000 residents. Families are advised to gather and keep warm in single rooms as they adjust to the cold.

  • Immediate impact felt from halting of Russian gas supply
  • Breakaway Transdniestria relied on gas pumped via Ukraine
  • Russian-speaking area split from Moldova in the 1990s
  • Families told to cover windows and huddle in one room
"We prepared two rooms for this emergency and installed electric fireplaces... so we will hold on like this, hoping that this whole situation with gas is temporary."

The Moldovan government is implementing measures to reduce energy consumption, with state officials noting improvements in energy load management.

item.title: 10 killed, 30 injured as truck rams into crowd in New Orleans; ‘terrorist attack,’ says mayor - The Indian Express
item.description:
Truck Rams into Crowd in New Orleans, Leaving 10 Dead and 30 Injured

Date: Wednesday, January 1, 2023

Source: BBC, CBS News

The incident occurred on Bourbon Street where a truck crashed into a crowd at high speed, followed by the driver exiting the vehicle and opening fire, resulting in a shootout with police.

  • At least 10 fatalities and 30 injuries were reported.
  • The New Orleans Mayor described the event as a “terrorist attack”.
  • The FBI is currently investigating the incident.
  • Injured individuals have been taken to five local hospitals.
  • This incident coincided with significant festivities, as it occurred during the New Year’s celebrations and shortly before a major college football game.
“There has been a mass casualty incident on Canal and Bourbon Street. Get yourself away from the area.” - Nola Ready

This tragic event has raised concerns about public safety during celebrations in crowded areas, amidst previous similar incidents in the city.

item.title: Two killed in Russian drone strike on Kyiv - Reuters
item.description:
Russian Drone Strike on Kyiv Claims Two Lives

Date: January 1, 2025 | Source: Reuters

Russia launched a drone strike on Kyiv on New Year's Day, resulting in two deaths and at least six injuries. Buildings were damaged in two districts, highlighting ongoing hostilities amid the nearly three-year-long invasion of Ukraine.

  • Two individuals were killed and at least six wounded in the strike.
  • Explosions were reported as air defenses engaged incoming drones.
  • Significant damage occurred in central Kyiv with portions of a residential building destroyed.
  • President Zelenskiy condemned the attack, noting Russia's ongoing aggression against Ukraine.
  • Kyiv's military reported downing 63 of 111 drones launched during the overnight assault.
"Even on New Year's Eve, Russia was only concerned about how to hurt Ukraine." - President Volodymyr Zelenskiy

This attack represents the continued pattern of Russian assaults on Ukrainian cities, further escalating the conflict as the New Year begins.

item.title: GST collections 7.3% up in December, totaling Rs 1.77 lakh crore - The Times of India
item.description:
GST Collections Rise by 7.3% in December, Reaching Rs 1.77 Lakh Crore

Publication Date: December 2023, Source: Economic Times

The Goods and Services Tax (GST) collections in India saw a significant increase of 7.3% in December, totaling Rs 1.77 lakh crore. This growth indicates a steady recovery in the economy.

  • GST collections in December totaled Rs 1.77 lakh crore.
  • This marks a 7.3% increase from the previous year.
  • The uptick in revenue is credited to robust tax compliance and economic activity.
  • December collections are among the highest recorded since the implementation of GST in 2017.
"Steady increase in GST collections reflects the improving economic environment in the country," said a government official.

This rise in GST collections is expected to bolster the government's revenue, allowing for further investment in infrastructure and public services.

item.title: Mouni Roy trips and falls on pavement after celebrating New Year with Disha Patani; husband Suraj Nambiar picks her up - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Mouni Roy trips and falls on pavement after celebrating New Year with Disha Patani; husband Suraj Nambiar picks her up

Date: Jan 01, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Mouni Roy took a tumble while exiting a New Year's Party in Mumbai, accompanied by her husband Suraj Nambiar and friend Disha Patani. Surrounded by paparazzi, Mouni lost her balance and fell on the pavement, but Suraj quickly helped her up.

  • Mouni was seen falling while leaving a New Year's party with Suraj and Disha.
  • Suraj held her hand to help her get up as the paparazzi clicked pictures.
  • Fans expressed concern for Mouni and criticized the paparazzi's invasiveness.
  • Mouni and Disha have been friends since participating in The Entertainers Tour together.
  • Mouni's recent work includes a series on Disney+ Hotstar and an upcoming film scheduled for 2025.
“Hope she is okay.”

In conclusion, Mouni's fall highlights the challenges celebrities face with paparazzi attention, but also shows the support of friends and family during unexpected situations.

item.title: BJP planning to demolish worship places in Delhi: CM Atishi - The Hindu
item.description:
BJP Planning Demolition of Worship Places in Delhi, Claims CM Atishi

Publication Date: January 01, 2025 - Source: The Hindu

Delhi Chief Minister Atishi accused the BJP of planning to demolish Hindu temples and a Buddhist worship place in the city, while promising support to religious leaders.

  • The Chief Minister claimed that a 'Religious Committee' ordered the demolition of six religious structures.
  • The BJP and Lieutenant Governor's office denied the allegations, stating no such orders were issued.
  • Atishi presented minutes of the meeting from the Religious Committee as evidence.
  • The affected locations include West Patel Nagar, Dilshad Garden, Sunder Nagri, Seema Puri, Gokal Puri, and New Usmanpur.
“The two-faced BJP has been exposed. On one hand, they claim to be defenders of the Hindus and on the other hand, they surreptitiously plan for demolition of temples.” - CM Atishi

The article outlines the growing tensions between the Delhi government and the BJP regarding the management of religious sites and raises concerns about potential political motivations behind the demolition plans.
